Area getting back to normal

The word 'help' was written in the snow around the George Washington statute in Boston's Public Garden. David L. Ryan/Globe Staff
Lance Marquardt of Duxbury chipped ice off a loading ramp outside the Fairview Restaurant and Inn on Ocean Street in Marshfield. Barry Chin/Globe Staff
A Boston.com reader shared this picture of people trying to move a car stuck in Revere.
A Boston.com reader from Lincoln shared this photo of Mouse enjoying the snow.
Chunks of ice floated off the coast of Quincy after the massive snowstorm. David L. Ryan/Globe Staff
David Wadsworth, 82, of Cohasset, arrived at a shelter set up at Weymouth High School on Sunday. Pat Greenhouse/Globe Staff
The MBTA resumed limited service on Sunday, but North Station remained a ghost town. Jim Davis/Globe Staff
A driver on Spring Valley Road in Methuen encountered a large flock of wild turkeys strolling down the street. Jim Davis/Globe Staff
Some homes on the coast of Hull were boarded up after the big storm. David L. Ryan/Globe Staff
The storm flooded homes in Scituate, where residents are struggling without power. David L. Ryan/Globe Staff

Pilgrim nuclear plant loses power again

Pilgrim Nuclear Power Station in Plymouth once again lost power today, after having it restored for several hours following an offsite outage Friday night.

Residents, a minister, and police have launched a gun buyback program in the town of fewer than 14,000 citizens in the wake of the Newtown, Conn. shooting.
